algorithms.RSSalg

Class RSSalg

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.Algorithm
      • algorithms.RSSalg.RSSalg

  • public class RSSalg
extends Algorithm
    Implementation of RSSalg from the paper:

    J. Slivka, A. Kovacevic, Z. Konjovic: "Combining Co-Training with Ensemble Learning for Application on Single-View Natural Language Datasets". Acta Polytechnica Hungarica 10 (2).

    RSSalg runs the co-training algorithm for the predefined number of times, each time using a different feature split (no. of splits is defined through noSplits in experiment properties). A statistics about building each of the co-training classifiers ClassifierEnsembleList is recorded (this statistics can also be loaded from a previously run experiment that recorded the statistics, e.g. Random from the paper). The recorded statistics is used to build a final classifier.

    The method of aggregating the statistics for the final classifier is defined by the class implementing the CandidateEvaluatorIF specified in the experiment properties. For example, RSSalg experiment is run by specifying RSSalgCandidateEvaluator in the experiment properties, while RSSalgbest experiment is run by using TestSetAccuracyCandidateEvaluator. Supply the AccuracyMeasure to the CandidateEvaluatorIF to run the RSSalg and RSSalgbest experiments from the paper (property optimizationMeasure in genetic algorithm properties).

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public ClassificationResult run(CoTrainingData data,
                                int fold,
                                int splitNo,
                                boolean recordClassifiers)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: Algorithm
        Run the algorithm
        Overrides:
        run in class Algorithm
        Parameters:
        data - separated labeled, unlabeled and test data
        fold - current fold of the n-fold-cross validation
        splitNo - the current feature split run for the fold (e.g. in RSSalg for each fold, m feature splits are created for co-training)
        recordClassifiers - whether to record statistics about building and testing each of the classifiers (see Algorithm.getClassifiers() and Algorithm.getClassifiersTestData())
        Returns:
        Classification result. The performance of the algorithm is evaluated on the test set defined in CoTrainingData object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an error running an algorithm

      • getName

        Description copied from class: Algorithm

        Returns:
        name of the algorithm.

      • setClassifiers

        public void setClassifiers(ClassifierEnsembleList classifiers)
        Description copied from class: Algorithm
        Algorithm can be supplied with already recorded statistic about building a classifier. E.g. user can run the experiment of co-training with multiple feature splits and record the statistic. Then, user can run RSSalg by supplying the recorded statistic (in order to use exactly the same classifiers created in co-training with multiple random splits experiment). In such case, RSSalg will not run co-training with multiple random splits again but simply aggregate the recorded votes in order to create the final classifier.
        Overrides:
        setClassifiers in class Algorithm
        Parameters:
        classifiers - list of created classifier ensembles
